content:
if its a question of who should win look no further than Bryan Cranston as Walter White in Breaking Bad. undoubtedly one of the greatest performances in television history Cranston is still keeping his captivated audience at the edge of their seats PERIOD With three Emmys already under his belt however the momentum from last season of Breaking Bad probably wont be enough to give Cranston another no matter how deserving PERIOD In terms of which actor has the highest chance of winning its a tie between Jon Hamm as Don Draper in Mad Men and Kevin Spacey as Francis Underwood in House of Cards. hamm has been nominated every year since  without a win but with Mad Men coming up on its final season the voters might show some pity PERIOD This category however might lean in Spaceys favor simply because the Emmy voters are suckers for wellrenowned film actors PERIOD

A version of this article appeared in the Thursday Sept PERIOD  print edition PERIOD Alex Mujica is a staff writer PERIOD Email her atemailprotected PERIOD
